pr_title: BAEL-4006 | Liskov Substitution Principle in Java

timeline.message: BAEL-4006 | Liskov Substitution Principle in Java
BAEL-4006 | UNDO unintentional commit to pom.xml

timeline.bodyText: Should we have the limit declare in the more conventional method protected int limit rather than with this quirky form?
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze
ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Comment format and indentation is not consistent.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Package name of l is probably not great. How about liskov?
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

replies.bodyText:
OK - this is a slightly tricky one.
These packages names were introduced for the examples used in https://www.baeldung.com/solid-principles article e.g. com.baeldung.s, com.baeldung.o, com.baeldung.l and so on.
I put my examples in a new package under com.baeldung.l called com.baeldung.l.advanced.
As much as I did not like the original package names, I did not want to include package name refactoring at least in the first pass of this PR. Now that you have reviewed the code for this article, I can do the refactoring as a separate commit. Please let me know what you think.
replies.author: rdevarakonda

timeline.bodyText: Do nothing? or throw exception as per other examples?
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

replies.bodyText:
As you picked up during the article review, this was deliberate to illustrate a code smell.
"Doing Nothing" with this comment 😉
replies.author: rdevarakonda

timeline.message: BAEL-4006 | Changes made to support the article review feedback implementation
BAEL-4006 | Minor change to a comment
